notes:
Company email (July 2015)
"I can assure you that Soleado is a vegan wine."

Company email (June 2015):
"I can assure you that Aussie Rosé Flamingo is a completely vegan wine."

Note from Louise (May 2014)

"I have information about a vegan wine. It’s a red wine called Chill Out Mountains Malbec Organic. On their Swedish homepage you can read: “Chill Out Mountains Malbec is a good choice for strict vegetarians as no animal products have been used in the processing/filtration of the product .”" [http://www.altia.se/se/HEM/]

1122301.Lukt: Aroma med fint preg av dill, karve, anis og litt sitrus.
1122301.Råstoff: Vann, kornbrennevin, krydderekstrakt, sukker og karamell.
1122301.Smak: Bløt og middels fyldig akevitt med preg av sitrus, karve og dill.

1201202.Lukt: Aroma med preg av lyst korn og fat med vanilje.
1201202.Metode: Destillert ved hjelp av tre ulike teknikker. 36-60 md. lagring på eikefat.
1201202.Smak: Bløt, litt sødmefull med streif av vanilje. Lett.

1299701.Lukt: Aroma preget av einer og litt sitrus.
1299701.Metode: Tradisjonell framstillingsmetode i kolonneapparater med bl.a. redestillasjon av smaksuttrekk. Ikke fat- eller flaskemodnet.
1299701.Råstoff: Sprit, finsk bygg, einerbær, koriander, angelikarot, kildevann
1299701.Smak: Ren gin med preg av einerbær og litt sitrus. God fylde.

1688501.Lukt: Aroma preget av sitrus og karve, innslag av anis og fat.

1688501.Smak: Bløt og middels fyldig akevitt med innslag av sitrus, karve og fat.

notes:
Company email (January 2017)

"We are not certified yet as a Vegan Winery, but we act as one. We do not use any milk, egg and honey derived and also we do not use any gelatines or isinglass.
Let's say for the Barolos from the last released vintage our wines are vegan, and for the Barbera from 2015 vintage. Also our wines are manufactured/bottled only here in La Morra at the winery."

company_name: Birds & Bees Organic Winery and Meadery
notes:
Company email (September 2012):
"We do not only produce fruit wine.  Our alfalfa wine is from a legume and rhubarb is actually classified as a vegetable!  Only our mead has honey. Our other wines are a wild black cherry, saskatoon, apple, raspberry, and high bush cranberry.
For finning, we use bentonite.
Our only production facility is here on our property which is 90 miles east of Edmonton.   We are Alberta's first and only organic winery and first meadery, having been established in 2005."

notes:
Company email (September 2013):
"Our whites go through a fining process that uses a combination of bentonite and casein so we realize these would not be vegan friendly. However our reds do not go through fining and are only filtered...  So the three wines that we need to change the status to Vegan Friendly are the 2011 Pinot Noir, 2012 Gamay Noir and the 2010 Reserve Pinot Noir.  Moving forward future vintages of the Red wines, Pinot Noir and Gamay Noir will continue to be filtered without any animal products.  Should our production methods change with respect to our white wines I will contact you and let you know about the changes."

Company email (November 2012):
"In regards to your questions below our wines do go through a very subtle fining, using a fining agent that contains animal product.

Lastly, our product is all Estate Bottled:  grown, produced and bottled on site."

notes:
Company email (August 2016):
"En referencia a sus dudas, comentarle que todos nuestros vinos, incluido la gama Manto, son aptos para vegetarianos y veganos. Adjuntamos certificado de ello. Esperamos haber resuelto sus dudas."

[Google translation: "In reference to your questions, tell all our wines, including the Manto range are suitable for vegetarians and vegans."]

Supplemented with a statement reading "que todos nuestros vinos proceden, única y exclusivamente, de la uva. No contienen gluten y, en al caso de los tintos, se usa proteina de guisante para su clarificacion. En el caso de los blancos para clarificar, se usa Bentonita." which Google translates to "that all our wines come solely and exclusively from grapes. They do not contain gluten and, in the case of red, pea protein is used for clarification. In the case of white to clarify, Bentonite is used"

Company email (January 2014):
"En el proceso de elaboración utilizamos una gelatina denominada "ICTIOCLAR" a base de pescado. En el proceso de filtración nuestras placas son de celulosa"

[Google translation] "Use the process of preparing a gelatin called "ICTIOCLAR" with fish. Filtration process in our plates are cellulose"

notes:
Company email (February 2014):
"I have just spoken with the winemaker who has informed me that they will be experimenting with a combination of bentonite and potato protein in the winemaking process as of next week."

Company email (February 2014):
"Here is a note from the winemaker regarding animal products in our wines:
All of Campbells fortified wines and red wines are vegan friendly, we do not use isinglass, casein or albumin on any of these products. All white wines previous to 2012 are also vegan friendly, however in 2012 we experimented with a new production method and we did use animal derived gelatine on producing our 2012 white wines. We are working on a way of eliminating gelatine from the “floatation” process but this will require further work next year as we have just started and gelatine was the recommended method to separate the solids from the juice. Hopefully in the future we will be able to use Bentonite an earth based product.

An update from the winemaker is that they will be experimenting with a combination on Bentonite and Potato protein to replace the gelatine in the wine making process from this week onwards.
Our wine is not produced anywhere else and is manufactured solely here at the winery."

Company email (February 2014):
"I have checked with our winemakers and they have confirmed with me that there has been no change to the process previously stated in the below email."

Company email (August 2012):
"All of Campbells fortified wines and red wines are vegan friendly, we do not use isinglass, casein or albumin on any of these products. All white wines previous to 2012 are also vegan friendly, however in 2012 we experimented with a new production method and we did use animal derived gelatine on producing our 2012 white wines. We are working on a way of eliminating gelatine from the “floatation” process but this will require further work next year as we have just started and gelatine was the recommended method to separate the solids from the juice. Hopefully in the future we will be able to use Bentonite an earth based product."

notes:
Company email (February 2014):
(Note from Tania: I just asked about six wines because they told me that they produce more than 40 different wines.)

"di seguito le risposte sui vini CANTI da lei richiesti 

Prosecco D.O.C. Frizzante 
Sangiovese – Merlot Rosé Daunia Sicilia I.G.T. 
Merlot – Sangiovese Sicilia I.G.T. 
Asti D.O.C.G. Millesimato 
Negroamaro-Zinfadel I.G.T. Puglia 
Chardonnay – Pinot Grigio Veneto I.G.T. 

Per nessuno dei 6 vini elencati utilizziamo prodotti allergenici, a parte i Solfiti, riportati in etichetta. 

I seguenti vini sono anche chiarificati con Gelatina (origine suina), ma di questa non ne restano residui nel prodotto finito: 
Sangiovese – Merlot Rosé Daunia Sicilia I.G.T. 
Merlot – Sangiovese Sicilia I.G.T. 
Negroamaro-Zinfadel I.G.T. Puglia 

sPERO di esserle stata utile."

[Google translation] "you will find answers about the wines CANTI requested by you 

Prosecco D.O.C. crisp 
Sangiovese - Merlot Rosé Daunia Sicily I.G.T. 
Merlot - Sangiovese Sicilia I.G.T. 
Asti D.O.C.G. Millesimato 
Negroamaro-Zinfadel I.G.T. Puglia 
Chardonnay - Pinot Grigio Veneto I.G.T. 

To use any of the 6 wines listed allergenic products, apart from the Sulfites, listed on the label. 

The following wines are fined with gelatin (porcine origin), but this residue does not remain in the finished product: 
Sangiovese - Merlot Rosé Daunia Sicily I.G.T. 
Merlot - Sangiovese Sicilia I.G.T. 
Negroamaro-Zinfadel I.G.T. Puglia"

Company email (January 2014):
"Some wines of the Canti  line, in the process of clarification, may come into contact with animal products, such as Potassium caseinate (for white wines) or pork gelatin (for red wines), but these substances do not remain in the finished product, as demonstrated by analysis that we made do by specialized laboratories.
Conservatively not declare that the our wines are suitable for vegans, but it can be demonstrated that DO NOT contain traces of animal protein by ultrafiltration and microfiltration processes they are subjected to the wine before bottling."
